comments: Corresponds to the numbers c(4,n) in the Klarner paper. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 24 2015
references: D. A. Klarner, The number of graded partially ordered sets, J. Combin. Theory, 6 (1969), 12-19.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: D. A. Klarner, The number of graded partially ordered sets, J. Combin. Theory, 6 (1969), 12-19. [Annotated scanned copy]
Index entries for sequences related to posets
formula: a(n) = Sum_{p+q+r+s=n} (n!/p!q!r!s!) 2^(pq+pq+rs) where (p,q,r,s) is any nonnegative composition of n. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 24 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 24 2015
